text: who's the greatest athlete of all time
well I guess the answer depends on how
you define greatness when I was 15 years
old Sandy Koufax declined to pitch in
Game one of the World Series because the
game fell on Yom Kippur I wasn't
familiar with the holiday at the time
but I was impressed at an athlete of
colfax of stature would place his
beliefs above a World Series start so I
immediately changed my criteria for
greatness and athletes it had to be more
than home runs and touchdowns and
rebounds but rather who use their
prominence to help change or influence
the course of human events Muhammad Ali
sacrificed a boxing title rather than go
to war Roberto Clemente died while
conducting a humanitarian mission and
Arthur Ashe used his prominence as a
tennis player to fight against apartheid
and AIDS who among this current
generation of athletes will we be
speaking about 50 years from now for
sacrifices they made or movements they
led Michael Jordan Michael scored a lot
of points but famously shied away from
social issues tiger woods tiger was
compromised by indulgences wrought by
celebrity and wealth so when you talk
about greatness using my criteria it's a
short debate and an even shorter list
